metadata.title: DOJ Seeking Confidential Information From Hospitals on Transgender Youth, Washington Post Reports

left: The Justice Department demanded the Children’s Hospital of Philadelphia provide information on gender-affirming care for minors, including patient names and Social Security numbers, according to a subpoena made public in a court filing.
Washington State Attorney General Nicholas W. Brown's office revealed that the subpoenas aim to support potential legal actions against health care providers offering gender-affirming care.
Since July, at least 25 hospitals in the U.S. have restricted services for transgender youth following the Supreme Court's decision to uphold Tennessee’s law banning gender-affirming care.
New York Attorney General Letitia James stated that the federal government is conducting a "cruel and targeted harassment campaign" against legitimate health care providers.
